info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 10 at 11:17AM EST until January 11 at 6:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL FAILURE OF FITCHVILLE POND DAM ON THE YANTIC RIVER IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash Flooding caused by a potential dam or levee failure is possible at the Fitchville Pond Dam. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following area, Northern New London. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dam failure may result in flash flooding of low-lying areas below the dam. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Please monitor the latest information and alerts from the CT Division of Emergency Management and Homeland Security.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Dam safety experts with state and local emergency services are monitoring the dam and will issue a public statement as conditions warrant. PLAN NOW so you will know what to do in an emergency. Keep informed by listening to local radio and television for statements and possible warnings. Follow the advice of public safety officials.
